title: Simulation-Based Expert Training Course for Elementary Mathematics Intervention Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: A course for practicing elementary mathematics intervention strategies in VR environments while refining small-group instruction techniques

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to analyze learning gaps and establish customized strategies through small-group elementary mathematics intervention simulations

Learners Can Monitor Intervention Effects in Real-Time Using VR-Based Formative Assessment Tools (e.g., Engage, AltspaceVR), Analyze Learner Engagement Metrics (Gaze Time, Interaction Frequency, etc.) with Over 80% Accuracy, and Establish Adjustment Plans for Feedback Implementation Within 24 Hours
Strengthen instructional design capabilities for number concepts and operational skills applied to elementary students with persistent mathematics difficulties
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
